revised_title: Experimental Investigation of Acute Cestode Tuberculosis in Cattle
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to investigate the effects of administering proglottides of Tenia mediocanellata to a calf. They observed symptoms of acute cestode tuberculosis, including nervous irritability, loss of appetite, and muscle tremors. Post-mortem examination revealed cysticercus vesicles in the calf's muscles, confirming the presence of the parasite.
